comments.body: Is this new tag documented or mentioned somewhere in this PR?

This would be a temporary change to enable Jenkins to use Docker as minikube's driver.
This way Kubernetes integration test would be successful.

More about it:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-34738?focusedCommentId=17324165&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-17324165

Yes, that's exactly what I mean. We had better mention this workaround and limitation (ignoring PVC tests) of this PR in the description for the reviewers.
> This would be a temporary change to enable Jenkins to use Docker as minikube's driver.
This way Kubernetes integration test would be successful.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +566,570 @@private[spark] object KubernetesSuite {
  val k8sTestTag = Tag("k8s")
  val pvTestTag = Tag("persistentVolume")
  val rTestTag = Tag("r")
  val MinikubeTag = Tag("minikube")

comments.body: Maybe trigger delete upon seeing the presence of logs that show that the first `.collect()` happened
Would be better to just run `kubectl get pods --field-selector status.phase=Running -l spark-app-locator=appLocator,spark-role=executor -n namespace` and do an assert on the number
Isn't shelling out here not great?
oh i meant using the fabric8 software `kubernetesClient.withLabel()....` just didnt want to write it all out
